page.title: 01GENERAL BACKGROUND
page.content: The section surveyed is in{Upper {Wensleydale}and part of{Raydale,}the area being administered by Richmondshire District Council and North Yorkshire County Council, the largest administrative area in England, and the{Yorkshire Dales {National Park. {Wensleydale}was originally known as Yoredale, hence the River Yore or Ure which flows through it.{Raydale}comes from Roe Dale as it was once roamed by deer, some of which are occasionally sighted in the dale today. The major land cover is rough pasture and meadow and the major land-use is for hill farming. There are three villages and a few hamlets. The main villages are{Askrigg and{Bainbridge.}A smaller village, {Worton,}was mentioned in the original {Domesday Book.}
